intro: Carpodinus calabarica, commonly known as the Calabar star, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped inflorescence. The plant features a thick, fleshy rhizome and produces small, clustered flowers surrounded by a spathe. Its leaves are typically broad and arrowhead-shaped, with a waxy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
